unnormalised: New Delhi: Cases of dengue fever are reportedly on the rise in several Indian cities, with hospitals in Delhi-NCR seeing a surge in admissions. AIIMS Delhi reported a 20% increase in dengue cases compared to last month. Dr. Rajesh Kumar, Head of Internal Medicine at Max Hospital, attributed the rise to the recent monsoon season and stagnant water accumulation. Symptoms to watch out for include high fever, severe headache, and joint pain.

unnormalised: Health officials are urging residents to take preventive measures, such as using mosquito repellent and ensuring that there is no standing water around their homes. The Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) is conducting fogging drives in affected areas.
